00020 /**
00021  * @file   SocketClient.h
00022  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00023  * @date   Mon Jan 25 11:07:19 2010
00024  * 
00025  * @brief  Basic version of a client that will open a socket to a server and
00026  *         read/write messages from that socket.
00027  * 
00028  */
00029 
00030 #ifndef SOCKETCLIENT_H
00031 #define SOCKETCLIENT_H
00032 #include <string>
00033 
00034 #include "util/SocketBase.h"
00035 
00036 /**
00037  * Class for reading and writing to a server over a socket.
00038  */
00039 class SocketClient : public SocketBase {
00040 
00041 public:
00042   /// Constructor
00043   SocketClient();
00044   /// Destructor closes sockets
00045   ~SocketClient();
00046 
00047   void cleanUp();
00048 
00049   /** 
00050    * Open a connection to a listening server.
00051    * 
00052    * @param host - ip address or name of computer to connect to, often just 127.0.0.1
00053    * @param port - which port to try and connect on.
00054    */
00055   void socketConnect(const std::string &host, const std::string &port);
00056 
00057   /** 
00058    * Try reading from the socket to see if there is anything sent.
00059    * 
00060    * @param messages - data from the socket as delivered by recv()
00061    */
00062   void checkForMsgs(std::vector<std::string> &messages);
00063 
00064   /** 
00065    * Write string to open socket.
00066    * 
00067    * @param msg - Message to write into the socket
00068    */
00069   void sendMsg(const std::string &msg, int type, int channel);
00070 
00071 private:
00072   int m_Socket;         ///< listening socket descriptor
00073   std::string m_Host;   ///< Host connected to
00074   std::string m_Port;   ///< Port that client is connected to
00075   std::vector<int> m_Sockets; ///< List of open sockets/file descriptors currently connected to, sorted by file descriptor
00076 
00077 };
00078 
00079 #endif /* SOCKETCLIENT_H */
